recipe.name: Chicken & Fresh Mozzarella Sandwich with Avocado & Spinach Salad

cookwares.name: grill pan, outdoor grill, or skillet

instructions.primary_message: Heat a grill pan, outdoor grill, or skillet over medium-high heat.
In a medium bowl, prepare marinade by whisking together oil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
instructions.secondary_message:
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
¼ tsp Italian seasoning
¼ tsp salt
¼ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Slice chicken in half horizontally to form thin fillets. Add to bowl with marinade and toss to coat.
Coat grill or bottom of skillet with oil. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, 2-3 minutes per side.
Preheat oven to broil and position rack under the broiler.
Wash and slice tomatoes into rounds. Halve and pit avocados; thinly slice ½ (save the rest for the salad) while still in skin and scoop out.
Slice mozzarella into rounds.
Place buns or rolls, cut side up, on a sheet pan. Top the bottom halves with avocado slices, chicken, tomato slices, and mozzarella. Leave the top halves as is so they get crusty.
Place in the oven and broil until cheese melts, 3-4 minutes.
Peel and mince garlic. In a large bowl, prepare dressing by combining garlic, oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, and remaining avocado. Mash together until smooth.
instructions.secondary_message:
2 cloves garlic
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
2 tsp red wine vinegar
¼ tsp salt
¼ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Wash and dry spinach. Add to bowl with dressing and toss to coat.
To serve, place sandwiches on a plate and have with spinach salad on the side. Enjoy!

recipe.name: Southwestern Black Bean Cakes with Guacamole & Corn

cookwares.name: stainless steel or cast iron skillet

instructions.primary_message: Drain and rinse beans.
Wash and dry jalapeños and cilantro. Seed and mince jalapeñso. Shave cilantro leaves off the stems; discard the stems and mince the leaves.
Transfer beans to a large bowl and mash with a fork. Add eggs, jalapeños, ½ of the cilantro (save the rest for the guacamole), bread crumbs, cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined.
instructions.secondary_message:
2 eggs
½ cup panko bread crumbs
1 tsp cumin
½ tsp salt
½ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Halve and pit avocados; scoop out the flesh into a medium bowl. Add remaining cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Mash with a fork until smooth.
instructions.secondary_message:
2 avocados
juice of 1 lime
½ tsp salt
¼ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Measure out corn.
Coat bottom of skillet with oil. Add corn and cook until heated through, 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Shape black bean mixture into 12-16 patties and place on a plate.
Once corn has been transferred, wipe skillet and coat with more oil. Working in batches, add patties and cook until browned and crisp, 3-4 minutes per side.
Peel and mince garlic. Add garlic, lime juice, salt, and pepper to corn; mix to combine.
instructions.secondary_message:
2 cloves garlic
juice of 1 lime
⅛ tsp salt
⅛ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Serve black bean cakes with guacamole and corn. Enjoy!
Fill a large pot halfway with water, season water with salt, cover and bring to a boil. Add pasta and stir for a few seconds. Cook, uncovered, until desired firmness, 8-10 minutes
While pasta is cooking, preheat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Chop the bacon into 1-inch pieces; add to the skillet and cook until crispy, 4-5 minutes. Once done, transfer to a plate lined with paper towels. Reserve 2 tbsp of bacon fat.
Meanwhile, crack the eggs into a medium bowl; add 3 tbsp cream and whisk to combine.
instructions.secondary_message:
4 eggs
1 ½ fl oz heavy cream

instructions.primary_message: Finely grate Parmesan and transfer to the bowl with egg mixture. Season with salt and pepper; whisk to combine.
instructions.secondary_message:
3 oz Parmesan cheese
1 tsp salt
½ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: When pasta is done, drain in a colander, reserving ½ cup of cooking liquid.
Trim off and discard the root ends of the garlic; peel and mince or press the garlic.
Add the reserved bacon fat to empty pasta pot. Return pot to heat, reduce heat to low. Add garlic, stirring until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Return pasta and bacon to pot. Remove pot from heat, add the egg mixture to pasta, stirring frequently. Stir just until the egg mixture begins to thicken, 3-4 minutes.
If the sauce seems dry, add some of the reserved pasta water 1 tbsp at a time, until rich and creamy.
Wash and dry parsley. Shave leaves off the stems; discard the stems and mince the leaves. Reserve a small amount for garnish and add the rest to the pot with the pasta.
To serve, divide pasta between bowls and garnish with remaining parsley. Enjoy!

recipe.name: Better Than Takeout Chicken Fried Rice

instructions.primary_message: Using a strainer or colander, rinse the rice under cold, running water, then drain and transfer to a small saucepan. Add water and bring the mixture to a boil over high heat.
instructions.secondary_message:
1 cup basmati rice
16 fl oz (2 cups) water

instructions.primary_message: Once the liquid comes to a boil, stir the mixture, cover the saucepan, and reduce the heat to low. Cook the rice until the liquid is fully absorbed, 15 to 18 minutes. Once done, remove the rice from the heat and let it stand, still covered, for 5 minutes.
Peel and mince garlic. Peel and small dice onion. Wash and dry carrots and green onions. Peel and small dice the carrots. Trim root ends and chop the onions. Measure out peas.
instructions.secondary_message:
2 cloves garlic
1 medium yellow onion
4 medium carrots
1 small bunch green onions (scallions)
2 cups frozen peas

instructions.primary_message: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Season with salt and pepper.
instructions.secondary_message:
1 ½ lb chicken breasts, boneless skinless
¼ tsp salt
¼ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Coat bottom of skillet with oil. Add chicken and, stirring occasionally, cook until cooked through, 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Return skillet to stove, increase heat to medium-high, and add more oil. Add garlic, yellow onion, carrots, and peas to skillet. Stir fry until tender, 2-3 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk eggs.
Move vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour eggs on the other side. Scramble eggs until cooked and mix with vegetables.
Uncover the rice and fluff with a fork.
Add rice, chicken, and soy sauce to vegetables. Stir until well combined and heated through, 1-2 minutes.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onions.
To serve, place fried rice in a bowl. Enjoy!

cookwares.name: stainless steel or cast iron skillet

instructions.primary_message: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Wash and dry the fresh produce. (Skip the spinach if it came pre-washed.)
instructions.secondary_message:
2 medium zucchini squash
1 small pkg fresh basil
1 small bunch Italian (flat-leaf) parsley
1 (5 oz) pkg baby spinach

instructions.primary_message: Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Peel and mince or press garlic.
Coat bottom of skillet with oil. Add ground beef and garlic. Break apart the beef with a spoon until crumbly. Stirring occasionally, cook until beef is browned, 4-6 minutes.
instructions.secondary_message:
1 ½ lb lean ground beef
1 tbsp virgin coconut oil

instructions.primary_message: Add the tomato paste and cook until fragrant, 1-2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and broth. Increase the heat to high and bring to a rapid simmer.
instructions.secondary_message:
1 (14.5 oz) can diced tomatoes
8 fl oz (1 cup) chicken or vegetable broth

instructions.primary_message: Shave leaves off the parsley stems; discard the stems and mince the leaves. Pick basil leaves off the stems, roll up crosswise, and thinly slice into ribbons. Put some of the fresh herbs aside to use as garnish.
Add the parsley, basil, spinach, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Continue to cook for another 4-5 minutes.
instructions.secondary_message:
½ tsp salt
¼ tsp black pepper

instructions.primary_message: Trim ends of the zucchini. Using a vegetable peeler, peel zucchini into thick noodle-like strips.

Remove the tomato sauce from the skillet, and set aside in a bowl.  Arrange the half of the zucchini in a flat layer that covers the bottom of the skillet.  Pour half of the tomato mixture over top of the zucchini noodles. Then arrange a second layer of zucchini noodles, followed by a second layer of sauce.
Thinly slice the mozzarella cheese. Finely grate the Parmesan cheese.
instructions.secondary_message:
½ (8 oz) block mozzarella cheese
4 oz Parmesan cheese

instructions.primary_message: Cover the top layer of sauce with mozzarella slices and sprinkle with Parmesan, place in the oven for 10-12 minutes. Put the oven to broil for the last few minutes to brown the top if desired.
Divide between plates, garnish with remaining fresh herbs, and enjoy!
